messages.message: Can I have a sanity check from someone? Do you think that `some_string.replace(some_pattern, replacement)` is exactly equivalent to `re.sub(some_string, re.escape(some_pattern), replacement)`?
i’m not sure what `re.escape` handles… but `([])` could cause gotchya’s.  @Aaron Vontell
The escape is to handle the case where strings replace doesnt do regexes, so if they want to replace `\s+`, I think it’s supposed to replace that literally
